messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([A-Za-z ]+,\s*)*[A-Za-z ]+'

Imagine a group of 21 scholars. Amir is connected to Wim, Raj, Jing, Wei, Nisha, and Reza. Sara is connected to Pari, Pam, Kim, Ian, Moin, and Puja. Zack is connected to Matt, Eva, Amy, Gia, Ming, and Prem. Nisha is connected to Reza, Wim, Raj, Jing, and Wei. Raj is connected to Jing, Wei, Reza, and Wim. Pam is connected to Jing, Kim, Ian, Moin, and Puja. Moin is connected to Puja, Pari, Kim, and Ian. Ming is connected to Prem, Matt, Eva, Amy, and Gia. Wei is connected to Reza, Wim, and Eva. Kim is connected to Ian, Puja, and Pari. Ian is connected to Puja and Pari. Gia is connected to Prem, Matt, Eva, and Amy. Reza is connected to Wim, and Jing. Puja is connected to scholars Pari. Prem is connected to Matt, Eva, and Amy. Wim is connected to Jing. Pari is connected to Amy. Amy is connected to Matt. Matt is connected to Eva. You have been told that Prem is donating 50 books and Moin is donating 10 books. Now, from Amir what is the shortest path to the person with the maximum number of books? Remember that you can take books only from one person. Starting from Amir, please list the scholar names in order, including Amir, separated by commas.

The shortest path from Amir to the person with the maximum number of books is **Amir, Wim, Prem**.

Prem has 50 books, which is the most number of books among all the scholars. We can find the shortest path to Prem using a breadth-first search algorithm. We start by adding Amir to the queue. We then repeatedly remove the first scholar from the queue and add any scholars that are connected to it to the queue. We continue this process until we reach Prem.

In this case, we will first add Amir to the queue. We then remove Amir from the queue and add Wim to the queue. We then remove Wim from the queue and add Prem to the queue.

We do not need to add any other scholars to the queue because Prem is the only scholar that is connected to Wim.

Therefore, the shortest path from Amir to the person with the maximum number of books is **Amir, Wim, Prem**.

However, you mentioned that Moin is donating 10 books, which means that Prem will have a total of 40 books after donating 10 books to you. In this case, the shortest path from Amir to the person with the maximum number of books is **Amir, Wim, Prem, Matt, Amy**.

Matt has 30 books, which is the most number of books after Prem donates 10 books. We can find the shortest path to Matt using a breadth-first search algorithm. We start by adding Amir to the queue. We then repeatedly remove the first scholar from the queue and add any scholars that are connected to it to the queue. We continue this process until we reach Matt.

In this case, we will first add Amir to the queue. We then remove Amir from the queue and add Wim to the queue. We then remove Wim from the queue and add Prem to the queue. We then remove Prem from the queue and add Matt to the queue.

We do not need to add any other scholars to the queue because Matt is the only scholar that is connected to Prem.

Therefore, the shortest path from Amir to the person with the maximum number of books after Moin donates 10 books is **Amir, Wim, Prem, Matt, Amy**.
